BasicClientCookie2(java.lang.String, jav.Description: Default Constructor taking a name and a value. The value may be null.

getPorts().Description: Returns null. Cookies prior to RFC2965 do not set this attribute

Returns: true if the cookie has expired.
isExpired(java.util.Date).Description: Returns true if this cookie has expired.

setPorts(int[]).Description: Sets the Port attribute. It restricts the ports to which a cookie may be returned in a Cookie request header.

setCommentURL(java.lang.String).Description: If a user agent (web browser) presents this cookie to a user, the cookie's purpose will be described by the information at this URL.

clone().Description: Creates and returns a copy of this Object. The default implementation returns a so-called "shallow" copy: It creates a new instance of the same class and then copies the field values (including object references) from this instance to the new instance. A "deep" copy, in contrast, would also recursively clone nested objects. A subclass that needs to implement this kind of cloning should call super.clone() to create the new instance and then create deep copies of the nested, mutable objects.

getCommentURL().Description: Returns null. Cookies prior to RFC2965 do not set this attribute

Returns: false if the cookie should be discarded at the end of the "session"; true otherwise

ClassDesc: Please use @B_java#net#URL#openConnection_E@ instead. Please visit HTTP "magic-cookie" represents a piece of state information that the HTTP agent and the target server can exchange to maintain a session as specified by RFC2965.
